abdomen.Definition: teil des körpers zwischen brust und becken

abortion.Definition: ending a pregnancy using either medicines (medical abortion) or an operation (surgical abortion).

adenomyosis.Definition: endometriosis in the muscle wall of the uterus.

adhesions.Definition: scars that connects two or more body structures together.

amniocentesis.Definition: a way of testing the fluid surrounding a baby in the womb by taking a small sample with a needle put into the womb through the abdomen. it can be carried out after the 15th week of pregnancy, and can detect some conditions, like down syndrome.

amniotic fluid.Definition: the watery liquid surrounding and protecting the growing fetus in the uterus.

amniotic sac.Definition: the pregnancy sac containing the baby and the amniotic fluid. it is sometimes also called "the membranes".

anaemia.Definition: a condition when the level of haemoglobin, the protein in blood which carries oxygen round the body, is lower than normal. it can be mild or severe and can cause tiredness, breathlessness, fainting, headaches. it can also cause your heart to beat faster.

anaesthesia.Definition: a medical way of relieving pain.

anaesthetist.Definition: a doctor trained to administer anaesthetics.

anal sphincter.Definition: the muscle around the anus that is squeezed to prevent passing wind or opening the bowels involuntarily.

antiphospholipid syndrome.Definition: a condition caused by your immune system mistakenly attacking healthy cells in your body. it can increase your risk of blood clots and of pregnancy complications such as recurrent miscarriage or stillbirth

anthracyclines.Definition: antibiotic drugs used in cancer chemotherapy.

antibiotics.Definition: medicines to fight an infection caused by bacteria.

antibody.Definition: protein(s) forming a major part of an organism's immune system

anticoagulant medication.Definition: medicines to reduce clotting in the blood vessels.

antigen.Definition: eine substanz im blut, die dabei hilft, das immunsystem zur bildung von antikörpern anzuregen. siehe blutgruppe.

anti-inflammatory drugs.Definition: medicines to stop or reduce swelling and redness.

antiretroviral drugs/therapy.Definition: medicines used to block the action of retroviruses (such as the hiv/aids virus) and the progress of infection. see also haart, hiv and retrovirus.

antispasmodic drugs.Definition: drugs which relieve cramps or spasms of the stomach, intestines, bladder and womb (uterus).

anus.Definition: öffnung für die ausscheidung von abfallstoffen aus dem verdauungstrakt

assisted birth\n(instrumental birth/oper.Definition: when special instruments (forceps or ventouse) are used to help deliver the baby during the pushing part of labour.

assisted conception/assisted reproductiv.Definition: treatments to help people conceive a baby. see also: intrauterine insemination, in vitro fertilisation, intracytoplasmic sperm injection, donor insemination.

autoimmune response.Definition: when the body produces antibodies which react against the body’s own tissues.

bacterial vaginosis (bv).Definition: a very common vaginal infection which results in discharge and soreness. it is caused by an imbalance in the types of bacteria in the vagina. it is not sexually transmitted and does not affect men.

bicornuate uterus (womb).Definition: a heart-shaped uterus. usually the uterus would be pear-shaped.

bile acids.Definition: bile acids are made in your liver and they help you to digest fat and fat soluble vitamins. intrahepatic cholestasis of pregnancy (obstetric cholestasis) is where you have a build up of bile acids in your body.

biopsy.Definition: medical test involving extraction of sample cells or tissues for examination

birth asphyxia.Definition: when a baby has experienced a reduced level of oxygen around the time of birth. affected babies may not breathe normally and may have a low heart rate.

bladder.Definition: organ in humans and vertebrates that collects and stores urine from the kidneys before disposal

bladder training.Definition: a way of teaching your bladder to hold more urine. it helps to reduce the number of times you need to pass urine and reduce urgency.

blood group.Definition: the way blood is classified by proteins (known as antigens) on the surface of your red blood cells. group a blood has a antigens, group b blood has b antigens, group ab blood has both a and b antigens and group o blood has no antigens.

body mass index (bmi).Definition: a measurement to work out the range of healthy weights for a person. it is calculated by dividing your weight (in kilograms) by your height (in metres squared – that is, your height in metres multiplied by itself). the healthy range is between 19 and 25.

brachial plexus injury.Definition: damage to the nerves in a baby’s neck.

brca.Definition: der name „brca“ ist eine abkürzung für „brustkrebs-gen“. brca1 und brca2 sind zwei verschiedene gene, von denen festgestellt wurde, dass sie das risiko einer person, an krebs zu erkranken, beeinflussen. jeder mensch besitzt sowohl das brca1- als auch das brca2-gen, die eine wesentliche rolle dabei spielen, unsere dna intakt zu halten. veränderungen (mutationen), die einen funktionsverlust in einem dieser gene verursachen, sind mit einem erhöhten risiko für brust- und eierstockkrebs verbunden. mutationen in brca2 werden auch mit prostata- und bauchspeicheldrüsenkarzinomen, melanomen und sarkomen in verbindung gebracht.

breech position.Definition: when the baby is lying bottom first in the womb.

ca125.Definition: ein protein im blut, das bei eierstockkrebs erhöht ist. es kann auch bei endometriose, schwangerschaft und infektionen erhöht sein.

caesarean birth.Definition: an operation in which a baby is born through a cut made in the wall of the abdomen and the uterus. it may be done as a planned (elective) or an emergency procedure.

cancer.Definition: group of diseases involving abnormal cell growth and spread

cardiotocography (ctg).Definition: a machine which traces the baby’s heart rate and the woman’s contractions before and during birth to assess the baby’s wellbeing.

catheter.Definition: medical tubes inserted in the body to extract or administer substances

cell.Definition: the tiny building blocks which make up the organs and tissues of the body.

cephalhaematoma.Definition: a bruise on the newborn’s head caused by a suction cup being used to help deliver the baby.

cervical screening.Definition: an internal swab test to check your cervix is healthy. it is sometimes called a smear test.

cervix.Definition: lower part of the uterus in the human female reproductive system

chickenpox.Definition: a viral infection (also called herpes zoster, varicella or varicella zoster). if a pregnant woman catches chickenpox, it may cause problems for her baby.

chignon.Definition: a swelling on the baby’s head as a result of a ventouse birth. it settles within a day or so.

chlamydia trachomatis.Definition: a sexually transmitted infection which can damage the reproductive system of both men and women if it is not treated promptly. chlamydia is treated with antibiotics. both partners require treatment.

cholesterol.Definition: sterol biosynthesized by all animal cells

chocolate cysts.Definition: cysts which form on the ovaries in some women who have endometriosis. also known as endometriomas.

chorioamnionitis.Definition: eine infektion im inneren der gebärmutter, die die membranen (chorion und amnion genannt) betrifft, die das fruchtwasser umgeben.

chromosomal abnormality.Definition: a different number or arrangement of chromosomes from the usual pattern.

chromosomes.Definition: the genetic structures within cells which contain our dna (the material that carries genetic information). a normal cell contains 46 chromosomes. see also gene.

chronic.Definition: something that persists or continues for at least six months.

clear margins.Definition: when no cell changes are present along the edge of tissue removed during treatment for cervical cell changes.

clinical guidelines.Definition: statements based on properly researched evidence which help healthcare professionals and patients to make decisions about medical care and treatments.

cmv.Definition: eine häufige infektion, die durch das herpes-simplex-virus verursacht wird und über körperflüssigkeiten (blut, muttermilch, speichel und sperma) von mensch zu mensch übertragen wird. cmv verursacht bei gesunden menschen normalerweise keine symptome. wenn sie sich jedoch zum ersten mal während der schwangerschaft anstecken, kann es manchmal auf das baby übertragen werden, was zu gesundheitlichen problemen führen kann.

colostrum.Definition: the first breastmilk produced during pregnancy and in the first few days after your baby is born.

colposcope.Definition: a type of microscope used to see the cervix in detail during colposcopy. it has a light attached and stays outside of the body.

colposcopist, colposcopy nurse specialis.Definition: a doctor or nurse who has completed medical or nursing training and continued onto colposcopy training.

colposcopy.Definition: a hospital examination used to diagnose, monitor and treat cervical cell changes.

complementary therapy.Definition: treatments and therapies that are not part of conventional medicine. examples include acupuncture, homeopathy and herbal medicine.

complete miscarriage.Definition: when all the tissue associated with a pregnancy has gone and the uterus is empty.

complications.Definition: problems that develop after an operation, treatment or illness.

consultant-led.Definition: a  consultant led maternity unit is a maternity unit where there are specialist doctors (obstetricians and anesthetists) as well as midwives, available at all times to look after you during your labour and the birth of your baby. there will also be neonatologists (doctors who specialize in the care of new born babies) available to look after your baby if they need additional support at birth. you may be advised to give birth in a consultant led unit if you have risk factors which may make labour or birth more complicated for you or your baby.

conception.Definition: when an egg is fertilised by sperm and then starts to grow in the womb.

condition.Definition: a state of being, like being healthy or fit, or having a problem, such as a heart problem.

continence.Definition: having full control of the bladder and/or bowel. see also stress incontinence.

contraception.Definition: contraception, or birth control, is what you and your partner can use to help prevent an unwanted pregnancy or to space out your pregnancies. there are many different forms of contraception  including condoms, hormonal pills and implants, hormonal and non-hormonal coils and permanent methods such as female sterilization or vasectomy. you can get more information about contraception from your gp or a family planning clinic.

corticosteroids.Definition: a group of hormones which may be used to suppress the body’s immune response or to reduce inflammation. also used during pregnancy in women who are thought may have their baby prematurely. they reduce the chance of the baby having problems from being born prematurely. see also steroids.

counsellor.Definition: a trained professional who helps people to make sense of feelings and issues.

ctg (cardio-tocograph).Definition: this is a machine that measures your baby's heart beat and your contractions by using sensors that are attached to your abdomen with an elastic belt

cystocele.Definition: when the bladder bulges into the weakened wall of the vagina. a lump may be seen or felt.

dilatation and evacuation (d&e).Definition: surgery using instruments to end the pregnancy.

deep vein thrombosis (dvt).Definition: a blood clot that forms in a deep vein.

delayed cord clamping.Definition: delaying the cutting of the umbilical cord for a few minutes, which allows time for extra blood to flow from the placenta into the baby.

delayed miscarriage/missed miscarriage/s.Definition: a pregnancy that has ended although the fetus is still inside the uterus. sometimes, because the fetus hasn’t developed, it can no longer be seen and there is just a fluid-filled sac inside the womb.

delivery.Definition: birth of a baby and its afterbirth (see placenta). a baby may be delivered through the vagina or by caesarean section.

diabetes.Definition: ein zustand, der durch einen hohen glukosespiegel (eine form von zucker) im blut verursacht wird. die menge an glukose in ihrem blut wird durch ein hormon namens insulin gesteuert. siehe auch diabates typ 1 und typ 2 weiter unten.

diabetes – type 1.Definition: a serious, lifelong condition where your blood glucose level is too high because your body can't make a hormone called insulin, which controls blood glucose.

diabetes – type 2.Definition: a serious condition where the insulin your pancreas makes can’t work properly, or your pancreas can’t make enough insulin. insulin is a hormone that controls blood glucose levels. if you blood glucose levels are too high it can cause a variety of health problems for you

diathermy.Definition: a surgical procedure to heat up and destroy body tissue or stop bleeding. also known as electrocoagulation.

dilatation.Definition: the process of your cervix opening during labour.

discharge letter.Definition: a letter a hospital doctor sends to a gp once treatment has finished telling the gp what has been done. the patient should be given a copy.

disease.Definition: abnormal condition that negatively affects an organism

donor insemination.Definition: when sperm from a donor is put into a woman’s vagina, cervix or womb to help start a pregnancy.

doppler.Definition: eine methode zur messung des blutflusses, beispielsweise durch die nabelschnur während der schwangerschaft.

ectopic pregnancy.Definition: when a fertilised egg (embryo) implants outside the womb (usually in one of the fallopian tubes).

early miscarriage.Definition: when a woman loses her baby in the first three months of pregnancy.

early pregnancy assessment unit.Definition: a clinic that specialises in problems in early pregnancy (under 12 weeks) where a woman receives medical care, counselling and treatment as required.

eclampsia.Definition: seizures/fits that are a potentially life-threatening complication of pre-eclampsia.

embryo.Definition: mehrzelliger diploider eukaryot in seinem frühesten entwicklungsstadium

emergency caesarean delivery.Definition: a caesarean delivery which was not planned during pregnancy. it is usually done because labour is not progressing normally or when the baby is unable to cope with labour and becomes distressed.

endometriosis.Definition: a condition where cells of the lining of the womb (the endometrium) are found elsewhere, usually around the pelvis and near the womb.

endometritis.Definition: entzündung der gebärmutterschleimhaut, die unwohlsein oder schmerzen verursacht.

enzyme.Definition: großes biologisches molekül, das als katalysator fungiert

epidural.Definition: eine betäubende injektion in den raum um die nerven in ihrem rücken, um den unterkörper zu betäuben.

episiotomy.Definition: a cut made through the vaginal wall and perineum to make more space to deliver the baby.

erb’s palsy.Definition: damage to the nerves in the baby’s neck (brachial plexus injury) which reduces movement of and feeling in the baby’s arm.

evidence-based medicine.Definition: a way of using reliable, objective, up-to-date evidence about how well different treatments or interventions work. it is also used to diagnose or predict the course of specific conditions.

extended or frank breech.Definition: the baby is bottom first, with the thighs against the chest and feet up by the ears. most breech babies are in this position.

external cephalic version (ecv).Definition: gentle pressure applied to the abdomen, if the baby is breech, by the obstetrician or midwife towards the end of pregnancy to help the baby turn in the uterus so it lays head first.

fallopian tubes.Definition: tubes in the human female reproductive system

female genital mutilation (fgm).Definition: the partial or total removal of a woman’s external genitals or other deliberate injury to her genital organs. it is illegal in the uk.

fertilisation.Definition: when a sperm enters an egg and an embryo forms. natural fertilisation takes place inside a woman’s fallopian tubes. it can also take place outside the body, which is known as assisted conception. techniques include ivf. see ivf and art.

fertility.Definition: the ability to conceive a baby and, for a woman, to become pregnant.

fertility drugs.Definition: treatment to encourage the ovaries to produce an egg. it is used during treatment for infertility.

fertility problem/infertility/subfertili.Definition: when a couple fail to conceive after having regular sexual intercourse for more than a year. ‘regular’ is defined as two or three times a week.

fetus.Definition: prenatal human between the embryonic state and birth

fetal medicine specialist.Definition: a doctor who specialises in the growth, development, care and treatment of an unborn baby.

fibroids.Definition: non-cancerous growths that develop in the muscle (myometrium) of the womb (uterus). a woman can have one fibroid or many, and they can be of different sizes. fibroids are sometimes known as uterine myomas or leiomyomas.

fimbriae.Definition: the fern-like ends of the fallopian tubes, near the ovaries.

first-degree tear.Definition: a small skin-deep tear of the perineum during childbirth which usually heals naturally.

flexed breech position.Definition: the baby is laying bottom first in the womb, with the thighs against the chest and the knees bent.

folic acid.Definition: a b vitamin which reduces the risk of a baby being born with a spinal defect such as spina bifida. ideally, a woman should take folic acid (400 micrograms) 3 months before conceiving. all women should take it for the first 12 weeks of pregnancy. a higher dosage (5 mg) is recommended if you are overweight, on epilepsy treatment, are diabetic or are having twin/triplets.

follicle.Definition: the part of the ovary where the egg develops.

follicle-stimulating hormone (fsh).Definition: hormones which help the development of follicles during a woman’s menstrual cycle and regulate sperm and hormone function in men.

footling breech.Definition: when a breech baby’s foot or feet are lying below its bottom.

forceps delivery.Definition: smooth metal instruments like large spoons or tongs which are used to help deliver the baby. see also assisted birth.

fourth-degree tear.Definition: a tear during childbirth which extends to the anal canal as well as the rectum.

gamma globulin (igg).Definition: a natural substance in the blood that protects against disease and infection. it is also used as a drug to boost immunity.

gastroenteritis.Definition: entzündung des magens und darms, die normalerweise zu durchfall oder erbrechen führt.

gastrointestinal.Definition: relating to the stomach and intestine.

gene.Definition: sequence of dna or rna that codes for an rna or protein product

genetic.Definition: relating to, caused or controlled by genes.

genetic counselling.Definition: discussions with a specialist to help you decide what to do if you, your partner or a close relative is found to carry an inheritable disease.

genitals.Definition: the sexual organs: in a woman, the vagina and vulva; and in a man, the penis and testicles.

genital herpes.Definition: an infection caused by the virus herpes simplex (the virus that also causes cold sores). it is passed from one person to another by skin-to-skin contact. see also herpes.

gestation.Definition: period during the carrying of an embryo

gestational age.Definition: the age of the baby in the womb, measured in weeks from the first day of the woman’s last menstrual period. a normal pregnancy lasts between 37 and 41 completed weeks, so a baby’s gestation is usually around 40 weeks.

gestational diabetes.Definition: a form of diabetes triggered during pregnancy.

gestational trophoblastic disease (gtd).Definition: an uncommon group of conditions involving the placenta, which includes complete and partial molar pregnancies

gestational trophoblastic neoplasia (gtn.Definition: this is a rare form of cancer which can develop from a molar pregnancy or other forms of gestational trophoblastic disease

gonadotrophin-releasing hormone agonist.Definition: a synthetic hormone-like drug which holds back the production of eggs.

gonadotrophins.Definition: hormones that help ovulation in women and the production of sperm in men. see also follicle-stimulating hormone, human chorionic gonadotrophin and luteinising hormone.

gonorrhoea.Definition: a sexually transmitted infection caused by the bacteria neisseria gonorrhoea or gonococcus. it is treated with antibiotics, and can cause long lasting damage in both partners if left untreated.

graduated elastic compression stocking.Definition: an elasticated stocking which helps reduce swelling from deep vein thrombosis (dvt).

group b streptococcus (gbs).Definition: a bacterium that is commonly present within the vagina. however, it can cause a serious infection in a newborn baby. it can also cause infection in the womb (endometritis).

guideline.Definition: recommendations for good medical practice. they help patients and their medical teams make decisions about care (like those produced by the rcog) and are developed by specialist teams who look at the best evidence available about care or treatment for a particular condition.

gynaecologist.Definition: a doctor who treats medical conditions and diseases that affect women and their reproductive organs.

highly active antiretroviral therapy (ha.Definition: a combination of drugs used to treat people with hiv. it works by blocking the action of the virus and the progress of the infection.

haematologist.Definition: a doctor who specialises in the diagnosis and treatment of diseases of the blood.

haemolysis.Definition: breaking down of red blood cells in the body.

haemorrhage.Definition: very heavy bleeding. in pregnancy it is called different names depending on the stage of pregnancy. it can happen:  before 24 weeks of pregnancy (threatened miscarriage or miscarriage if the pregnancy is lost) after 24 weeks of pregnancy (antepartum haemorrhage) immediately after birth (postpartum haemorrhage)

hellp syndrome.Definition: a combined liver and blood clotting disorder which is a complication of pre-eclampsia.

heparin.Definition: eine art gerinnungshemmendes medikament, das durch injektion verabreicht wird.

herpes.Definition: eine familie von viren, die eine reihe von infektionen verursachen, darunter windpocken (herpes zoster oder varizellen), fieberbläschen und herpes genitalis (herpes simplex).

high-dependency unit.Definition: a ward or area in a hospital that provides care for people who need intensive observation or treatment.

hormone treatment.Definition: the use of hormones to treat disease or to replace hormones no longer produced by the body.

hormones.Definition: naturally occurring substances made in the body which control the activity of normal cells. they include: follicle stimulating hormone, gonadotrophins, human chorionic gonadotrophin, luteinising hormone, estrogen, progesterone, prostaglandin.

hrt.Definition: bei der hormonersatztherapie werden hormone zur behandlung von symptomen eingesetzt, die mit einem niedrigen hormonspiegel im körper zusammenhängen.

human chorionic gonadotrophin (hcg).Definition: a hormone made by the placenta which shows up in a woman’s blood or urine if she is pregnant. may be used as part of assisted conception to help eggs to mature and to help an embryo attach to the womb.

human immunodeficiency virus (hiv).Definition: a viral infection which attacks the body’s immune system, making it hard to fight off other infections. hiv is passed through contact with body fluids (blood, semen, vaginal fluid and breast milk).

human papillomavirus or hpv.Definition: a common virus that most men and women will have at some point in their life. in most people, hpv will go away by itself without causing problems. a few types of hpv can cause cell changes that may develop into cancer.

hyperprolactinaemia.Definition: a disorder which increases the normal level of the hormone prolactin. it can cause irregular periods and fertility problems.

hypertension.Definition: long-term high blood pressure in the arteries

hypothalamus.Definition: bereich des gehirns unterhalb des thalamus

hysterectomy.Definition: an operation to remove the cervix and womb, carried out through a cut on the abdomen (abdominal hysterectomy) or the vagina (vaginal hysterectomy). the ovaries can be removed at the same time, if necessary.

hysterosalpingo-contrast-sonography.Definition: an ultrasound test of the fallopian tubes or the womb, using fluid injected through the cervix.

hysterosalpingogram (hsg).Definition: an x-ray of the fallopian tubes or the womb, using fluid injected through the cervix.

hysteroscopy and endometrial biopsy.Definition: a small operation which opens the entrance to the womb (cervix) to remove tissue from the lining of the womb (the endometrium).

immune system.Definition: biological system protecting an organism against disease

immunity.Definition: protection against infectious diseases through the action of the immune system. you can become immune to some diseases by catching them. vaccinations also provide immunity.

immunotherapy.Definition: treatment to prevent or change the response of the immune system.

implantation.Definition: der prozess, durch den sich ein embryo an der gebärmutterschleimhaut festsetzt.

in vitro fertilisation (ivf).Definition: a technique where eggs are collected from a woman and fertilised with a man’s sperm outside the body. usually one or two embryos are then transferred to the womb. if one or more of them implants successfully, the woman becomes pregnant.

incomplete miscarriage.Definition: when a miscarriage has started but some tissue remains in the uterus.

incontinence.Definition: not having full control over the bladder and/or bowel. problems with incontinence can range from slight to severe. see also stress incontinence.

infectious.Definition: conditions which can be passed from person to person by micro-organisms like viruses or bacteria.

infertility/subfertility/fertility probl.Definition: when a couple fail to conceive after having regular sexual intercourse for more than a year. ‘regular’ is defined as two or three times a week.

inflammation.Definition: physical effects resulting from activation of the immune system

informed decision/choice.Definition: providing enough quality information about a suggested treatment to help a patient decide whether to go ahead. this information must be balanced, up to date, evidence-based and given in a way that the patient can understand.

infusion.Definition: eine möglichkeit, ein medikament oder eine flüssigkeit über einen bestimmten zeitraum hinweg mit einer gleichmäßigen geschwindigkeit in den blutkreislauf zu injizieren.

intensive care unit.Definition: a specialist unit within a hospital that provides extra care for seriously ill people.

intracytoplasmic sperm injection (icsi).Definition: a form of assisted conception in which a single sperm is injected into an egg.

intrauterine contraceptive device (iucd).Definition: a small device fitted into the womb to prevent conception. made of plastic and copper, it has one or two soft threads at the end which emerge through the cervix into the top of the vagina.

intrauterine insemination (iui).Definition: eine form der assistierten empfängnis, bei der spermien durch den gebärmutterhals in die gebärmutter einer frau gelangen.

intrauterine system (ius).Definition: a small t-shaped contraceptive device that is fitted into the womb. made of plastic, it slowly releases the hormone progestogen.

intravenous drip (iv drip).Definition: fluids put into a vein to rehydrate the body. drips contain different combinations of minerals and chemicals, for example sugar and carbohydrate to provide extra energy.

invasive.Definition: a medical procedure when a cut is made to the body or an instrument is inserted.

irritable bowel syndrome (ibs).Definition: a chronic disorder involving abdominal pain, bloating and changes in bowel habits, such as diarrhea. it is caused by an overactive bowel.

karyotype.Definition: a record of the complete set of your chromosomes.

karyotyping.Definition: a procedure to produce a karyotype using a blood or tissue sample. it is used to check for abnormalities in the chromosomes.

ketones.Definition: an acid remaining when the body burns its own fat. it is often a sign of dehydration and can be tested by a blood or urine test.

kidney.Definition: vertebrate organ that filters blood and produces urine

klumpe’s paralysis.Definition: reduced movement in the baby’s arm from damage to nerves in the baby’s neck (see brachial plexus injury).

laparoscopic ovarian drilling/diathermy.Definition: a surgical treatment for polycystic ovary syndrome to improve irregular periods. small cuts are made in the abdomen and an electrical current is used to destroy a tiny part of the ovaries.

labour.Definition: the stages of childbirth. labour is divided into three stages; first, second and third.

laparoscopy.Definition: keyhole surgery involving up to four small cuts in the abdomen. a telescopic microscope (called a laparoscope) is inserted into the body to help diagnosis or treatment.

laparotomy.Definition: a cut up to 14 inches long giving surgeons access to the abdomen.

lletz.Definition: eine übliche behandlung von zellveränderungen im gebärmutterhals, bei der ein schlaufenförmiger draht verwendet wird, um den betroffenen bereich zu entfernen. manchmal auch elektrochirurgischer schleifenexzisionsvorgang (leep) genannt. siehe lettz-patienteninformation.

lupus.Definition: ein zustand, der dadurch verursacht wird, dass ihr immunsystem fälschlicherweise gesunde zellen in ihrem körper angreift. zu den symptomen können haut-, gelenk- und nierenprobleme gehören. extreme müdigkeit und muskelschmerzen.

luteinising hormone (lh).Definition: a natural hormone released during the menstrual cycle to help stimulate ovulation.

lynch syndrome.Definition: also known as hereditary non-polyposis colorectal cancer (hnpcc), is a type of inherited cancer syndrome associated with a genetic predisposition to different cancer types. this means people with lynch syndrome have a higher risk of certain types of cancer

major placenta praevia.Definition: a low-lying placenta entirely covering the cervix. see also placenta praevia.

meconium.Definition: the poo that your baby does when they are first born. it is black and sticky like tar. sometimes your baby can do a poo (pass meconium) before they are born. if this happens you may be advised to have closer monitoring during labour and your baby will be monitored more closely when they are first born.

medical abortion.Definition: a way of ending a pregnancy by using medicines. see also abortion and surgical abortion.

membranes.Definition: another word for the amniotic sac.

mesh.Definition: mesh (sometimes known as tape) is a synthetic plastic product that looks like a net. it stays in the body permanently. a natural mesh can be created using a strip of tissue (fascia) taken from another part of the body, usually abdominal wall or thigh, which is also known as fascial or autologous sling.

meningitis.Definition: entzündung im gehirn, die durch einen virus oder ein bakterium verursacht wird.

menopause.Definition: der zeitpunkt, an dem die periode einer frau aussetzt, normalerweise im alter von etwa 50 jahren. siehe auch menstruationszyklus.

menstrual cycle.Definition: natural changes in the human female reproductive system

meta-analysis.Definition: a way of combining and contrasting results from different studies with the aim of finding underlying patterns common to all.

miscarriage.Definition: the unplanned ending of a pregnancy before 23 completed weeks.

midtrimester.Definition: the middle stage of pregnancy, between 13 and 26 weeks.

molar pregnancy.Definition: a rare condition where the placenta overgrows and the embryo does not form correctly.

multiple pregnancy.Definition: when a woman is carrying more than one baby, e.g. twins or triplets.

musculoskeletal.Definition: the body’s support structure: the bones, ligaments, joints and muscles.

neonatal unit.Definition: an intensive care unit designed with special equipment to care for premature or seriously ill newborn babies.

neonatalologist.Definition: a doctor who specialises in caring for newborn babies.

neural tube defects.Definition: abnormalities of the skull or back bone of a developing baby that happen during the first 12 weeks of your pregnancy and which will affect your baby from birth. taking folic acid before becoming pregnant and for the first 3 months of pregnancy can help to prevent neural tube defects.

obstetrician.Definition: a doctor who specialises in the care of pregnant women.

oedema.Definition: swelling in any part of the body.

oligohydramnios.Definition: too little fluid (amniotic fluid) surrounding the baby in the uterus.

oocyte donation.Definition: when eggs are donated to help another women become pregnant.

ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome (ohss).Definition: a potentially serious complication of fertility treatment, particularly of ivf. symptoms are abdominal swelling or bloating, nausea and vomiting.

ovaries.Definition: female reproductive organ that produces egg cells

ovulation.Definition: der prozess, bei dem die eierstöcke jeden monat eine eizelle produzieren und freigeben. der eisprung findet normalerweise etwa 10–16 tage vor der periode statt.

oxytocics.Definition: drugs that stimulate the womb to contract.

peer review.Definition: evaluation of work by one or more people of similar competence to the producers of the work

paediatrician.Definition: a doctor who specialises in the care of babies, children and teenagers.

pelvic examination,\nbimanual/internal.Definition: a check to feel the size and position of the womb and other reproductive organs to rule out any abnormality or problem.

pelvic floor muscles.Definition: layers of muscle which support the bladder and other organs in the pelvis.

pelvic inflammatory disease (pid).Definition: an infection in the womb, fallopian tubes and/or pelvis caused by infections such as chlamydia and gonorrhoea.

pelvis.Definition: lower part of the trunk of the human body between the abdomen and the thighs

perineal tear.Definition: when the perineum (area between your vaginal opening and anus) tears during childbirth.

perineum.Definition: körperregion einschließlich des dammkörpers und der umgebenden strukturen

period.Definition: a bleed from the vagina between every 3 to 5 weeks which forms part of the menstrual cycle (see menstrual cycle).

peritoneum.Definition: das gewebe, das die bauchdecke auskleidet und die meisten organe im bauchraum bedeckt.

pessaries.Definition: a medication or device which is placed in the vagina.

physiotherapy.Definition: special exercises and physical activities to improve body function and strength.

pituitary gland.Definition: endocrine gland at the base of the brain

placenta.Definition: organ that connects the fetus to the uterine wall

placenta accreta.Definition: when the placenta is attached to the muscle of the womb and does not come away properly after the birth.

placenta praevia.Definition: a condition where the placenta covers all or part of the cervix. if the placenta does not move sufficiently it may be necessary to perform a caesarean. see also major placenta praevia.

platelets.Definition: specialised cells necessary for blood clotting.

polycystic ovaries.Definition: ovaries which have at least twice as many developing follicles as normal ovaries in the early part of the menstrual cycle.

polycystic ovary syndrome (pcos).Definition: a condition which can affect a woman’s menstrual cycle, fertility, hormones and aspects of her appearance. it can also affect long-term health.

polyhydramnios.Definition: too much fluid (amniotic fluid) surrounding the baby in the uterus.

post-mortem.Definition: a medical examination of the body to find a cause of death.

postnatal.Definition: der zustand des babys nach der geburt.

postpartum haemorrhage.Definition: heavy blood loss after the delivery of the baby.

pre-eclampsia (also known as toxaemia).Definition: a condition that occurs in the second half of pregnancy, associated with high blood pressure and protein in the urine.

pregnancy test.Definition: a test on a sample of urine or blood to confirm whether a woman is pregnant. the test works by detecting the presence of a pregnancy hormone.

premature birth / preterm birth.Definition: when your baby is born before 37 completed weeks of pregnancy.

preterm labour.Definition: labour that happens before 37 weeks of pregnancy.

preterm premature rupture of membranes.Definition: when a pregnant woman’s waters break before 37 weeks of pregnancy.

progesterone.Definition: a hormone produced as a result of ovulation. it prepares the lining of the womb to enable a fertilised egg to implant there.

progestogen.Definition: a synthetic hormone, similar to progesterone. it thickens the mucus around the cervix, making it difficult for sperm to get into the womb or for a fertilised egg to implant in the womb.

prolactin.Definition: the hormone which is responsible for producing breast milk.

prolapse.Definition: where the bladder, womb or bowel pushes through the wall of the vagina.

prostaglandin.Definition: das hormon, das dafür sorgt, dass sich die gebärmutter während der wehen zusammenzieht. synthetische prostaglandine können zur einleitung der wehen oder bei medizinischen abtreibungen zum abbruch einer schwangerschaft eingesetzt werden.

pubic, pubis.Definition: the area around the bone at the front of the pelvis.

pudendal block.Definition: a local anaesthetic injection inside the vagina.

pulmonary embolus.Definition: part of a blood clot (dvt) which breaks off and travels in the blood stream and becomes stuck in the lung.

randomised controlled trial (rct).Definition: a study which tests the effectiveness and safety of treatments or procedures as fairly and objectively as possible. by randomly assigning patients to different treatments for the same problem, the results can be assessed equally with the aim of discovering the best possible procedure for the condition.

rectocele.Definition: when the rectum bulges into the weakened wall of the vagina. a lump may be seen or felt.

rectum.Definition: final portion of the large intestine

recurrent miscarriage.Definition: when a woman loses three or more babies before 23 completed weeks.

regional anaesthetic.Definition: this is anaesthetic given to numb part of your body for an operation and is an alternative to a general anaesthetic (where you are asleep for your operation). there are different types of regional anaesthetic including spinal anaesthetic and epidural anaesthetic. these are commonly used for caesarean births.

reproductive organs.Definition: the parts of the male and female body needed to create and sustain a pregnancy.

reproductive years.Definition: in women, the time from the start of menstrual periods (menarche) to the menopause.

retrovirus.Definition: eine art virus. hiv ist ein retrovirus. siehe auch haart und antiretrovirale therapie.

rhd antigen.Definition: a protein on the red blood cells of 85% of people in the uk. these people are known as rhd positive. people who do not have the protein are described as rhd negative. see also blood group.

risk.Definition: the chance that an activity or hazard will give rise to harm. risk is generally given in terms of numerical odds (1 in 10) or percentages (10%).

royal college of obstetricians and gynae.Definition: we are the professional body who oversee the medical education, training and examination of obstetricians and gynaecologists in the uk and many places overseas. we set internationally recognised standards and produce clinical guidelines for treatment and care.

rupture of membranes.Definition: the medical term for the breaking of waters in pregnancy.

sanitary pad.Definition: a disposable pad of absorbent material used to collect blood during menstruation and after childbirth.

scientific evidence.Definition: information gathered in a systematic way to confirm or disprove a particular idea. growing understanding may result in established practices being changed.

screening.Definition: ein test oder eine reihe von tests, um bei einer person, die keine symptome zeigt, bei der jedoch ein risiko besteht (z. b. aufgrund ihres alters oder ihres sexuellen verhaltens), auf eine erkrankung zu prüfen.

second-degree tear.Definition: a tear during childbirth which affects the muscle of the perineum as well as the skin, and usually requiring stitches.

second stage of labour.Definition: the period when the cervix is fully dilated until the birth. this is the time when the woman will start pushing.

‘see and treat’.Definition: a phrase sometimes used to describe treatment being offered at a first colposcopy appointment.

sepsis.Definition: die überreaktion des immunsystems auf eine infektion oder verletzung, die zu gewebeschäden, organversagen und tod führen kann.

severe pre-eclampsia.Definition: when pre-eclampsia has progressed and treatment is required or the baby needs to be delivered.

sexually transmitted infection (sti).Definition: an infection that is passed on through close physical contact during sex. some stis have no symptoms, so it is important to be tested if you think you have been at risk. see also chlamydia, genital herpes and hiv.

shoulder dystocia.Definition: a situation during birth when the baby’s head has been born but one of the shoulders becomes stuck behind the mother’s pelvic bone, preventing the birth of the baby’s body.

sickle cell disease (scd).Definition: an inherited condition in which red blood cells, which carry oxygen around the body, develop abnormally.

skin to skin contact.Definition: having your baby on you with their naked skin next to yours. this helps with temperature control, establishing breast feeding and bonding with your new baby

sonographer.Definition: a healthcare professional who uses ultrasound equipment to scan your baby to in order to check their growth and development

special care baby unit.Definition: a specialist unit in a hospital to care for premature babies.

speculum.Definition: a plastic or metal instrument used to separate the walls of the vagina to show or reach the cervix.

sperm.Definition: male reproductive cell in anisogamous forms of sexual reproduction

spina bifida.Definition: eine erkrankung, die das ungeborene kind in den frühen stadien der schwangerschaft betrifft. spina bifida verursacht schäden am rückenmark und an den nerven.

spinal anaesthesia.Definition: an anaesthetic injection into the lower back that numbs the lower body so surgery can be carried out in this area without you feeling any pain.

spontaneous vaginal birth.Definition: the natural birth of a baby through the vaginal canal without assistance.

sterilisation.Definition: dauerhafte empfängnisverhütung für frauen (siehe tubenverschluss) und männer (siehe vasektomie).

steroids.Definition: a group of natural or synthetic hormones. see also corticosteroids.

stillbirth.Definition: when a baby is born dead after the 23rd completed week of pregnancy.

stool (or faeces).Definition: the waste matter discharged in a bowel movement.

stress incontinence.Definition: leaking urine during everyday activities like coughing, laughing or exercising. this usually happens because the muscles that support the bladder are too weak.

succenturial lobe.Definition: an additional piece of placenta connected by membranes.

surgical abortion.Definition: a type of abortion using suction instruments or d&e to end a pregnancy. see also abortion and medical abortion.

sutures.Definition: stitches which may dissolve, or remain within the body permanently.

symphysis fundal height.Definition: a measure of the size of the uterus used to monitor a baby’s growth and development during pregnancy.

syndrome.Definition: association of several clinically recognizable features

systematic review.Definition: comprehensive review of research literature using systematic methods

thrombophilia.Definition: a blood clotting abnormality which tends to run in families, whereby the blood is more likely to clot than usual.

tampon.Definition: ein schlauch aus absorbierendem material, der in die vagina passt, um das menstruationsblut aufzusaugen.

temperature.Definition: the degree of hotness or coldness of a body or an environment.

testosterone.Definition: a male hormone that occurs in small amounts in women and can be used as a part of hormone replacement therapy

third-degree tear.Definition: a tear during childbirth which extends downwards from the vaginal wall and perineum to the anal sphincter, the muscle that controls the anus.

threatened miscarriage.Definition: bleeding before 24 weeks of pregnancy which occurs without harm to the baby.

thrombosis.Definition: medical condition caused by blood clots

to open bowels.Definition: to go to the toilet to pass solid waste.

tocolysis.Definition: treatments used to delay or prevent early labour.

transabdominal scan.Definition: a scan where the probe is moved across the abdomen.

transvaginal scan.Definition: a scan where the probe is placed inside the vagina.

transverse position.Definition: when the baby is lying across the womb.

trimester.Definition: einen zeitraum von drei monaten. die schwangerschaft ist in drei trimester unterteilt: erstes trimester – bis etwa 13 wochen, zweites trimester – bis etwa 13 bis 26 wochen, drittes trimester – etwa 27 bis 40 wochen

tubal occlusion.Definition: an operation which blocks, seals or cuts the fallopian tubes. also known as sterilisation. it is a permenant method of contraception for women.

ultrasound.Definition: high-frequency sound waves used to provide images of the body, tissues and internal organs.

umbilical cord (umbilicus).Definition: the cord that connects a mother’s blood system with a baby’s (through its navel) and which is cut after the birth.

urethra.Definition: tube that connects the urinary bladder to the external urethral orifice

urethracele.Definition: when the tissues that hold the urethra in place weaken, causing it to move and put pressure on the vagina, sometimes pushing through the wall of the vagina.

urine.Definition: liquid by-product of metabolism in the bodies of many animals, including humans

urodynamics.Definition: tests to assess how the bladder is working.

uterine rupture.Definition: this is when the muscle of your uterus (womb) tears, usually because of contractions while you are in labour. it is rare but more common if you have had previous operations on your uterus including caesarean births. it is an emergency affecting both you and your baby and if it happens you are likely to need an emergency caesarean birth.

uterine sarcoma.Definition: a disease in which malignant (cancer) cells form in the muscles of the uterus or other tissues that support the uterus, rather than the lining of the womb, as in the case of uterine carcinoma.

uterus (also known as womb).Definition: the organ where a baby develops during pregnancy. made of muscle, it is hollow, stretchy and about the size and shape of an upside-down pear. it sits between the bladder and the rectum in a woman’s pelvis.

vaginal discharge.Definition: any vaginal secretion except menstrual bleeding.

(normal) vaginal discharge.Definition: a clear or whitish fluid that comes from the vagina or cervix.

(abnormal) vaginal discharge.Definition: an abnormal smelling yellow or green discharge which should be assessed by a doctor.

vaginal examination – internal.Definition: a check to feel the size and position of the vagina and cervix to check there isn’t any abnormality or problem. this may be carried out using a speculum.

vaginal swab.Definition: similar to a cotton bud, but smaller and rounder. some have a small plastic loop at the end instead of a cotton tip. it is wiped over the vagina to collect samples of fluid to check for infection.

vaginal thrush.Definition: an infection caused by a yeast known as candida albicans. symptoms include redness and itching around the genital area and unusual vaginal discharge.

varicella.Definition: the medical name for chickenpox. see chickenpox.

vas deferens.Definition: part of the male reproductive system of many vertebrates

vasectomy.Definition: a permanent method of contraception for men. it blocks, seals or cuts the tube (the vas deferens) which carries sperm from the testicles to the penis. also known as sterilisation.

vein.Definition: blood vessels that carry blood towards the heart

velamentous cord insertion.Definition: normally the umbilical cord inserts into the centre of the placenta. velamentous cord insertion is when it runs through the membranes before reaching the placenta

venous thrombosis.Definition: blood clot (thrombus) that forms within a vein

ventouse delivery.Definition: a way of helping deliver a baby by using suction through a special cup placed on the baby’s head.

virus.Definition: infektionserreger, der sich in zellen vermehrt

weak cervix.Definition: when the cervix (the neck of the womb) opens too early in pregnancy, in the second trimester, and without contractions. used to be known as ‘incompetent cervix’.

white cell.Definition: cells in the lymphatic and blood systems of the body which fight infection. they are part of the body’s immune system.

white cell count.Definition: a count to measure the number of white blood cells.

thorax.Definition: vorderer teil des körpers eines tieres, zwischen kopf und hinterleib

abductor pollicis longus muscle.Definition: muscle in the forearm moving the thumb

abscess.Definition: localized collection of pus that has built up within the tissue of the body

eye.Definition: organ that detects light and converts it into electro-chemical impulses in neurons

accommodation reflex.Definition: the accommodation reflex is a reflex action of the eye, in response to focusing on a near object, then looking at a distant object, comprising coordinated changes in vergence, lens shape (accommodation) and pupil size. it is dependent on cranial nerve ii, superior centers (interneuron) and cranial nerve iii. the change in the shape of the lens is controlled by ciliary muscles inside the eye. changes in contraction of the ciliary muscles alter the focal distance of the eye, causing nearer or farther images to come into focus on the retina; this process is known as accommodation. the reflex, controlled by the parasympathetic nervous system, involves three responses: pupil constriction, lens accommodation, and convergence.

acetabulum.Definition: cavity where the thigh bone (femur) articulates with the pelvis

hip (anatomy).Definition: anatomical region between the torso and the legs, holding the buttocks and genital region

achilles tendon.Definition: tendon at the back of the lower leg

plantaris muscle.Definition: one of the superficial muscles of the superficial posterior compartment of the leg,

soleus muscle.Definition: powerful muscle in the back part of the lower leg

muscle.Definition: basic biological tissue present in animals

calcaneus.Definition: bone of the tarsus of the foot

cutaneous condition.Definition: any medical condition that affects the integumentary system

hair follicle.Definition: organ found in the dermal layer of the mammalian skin that regulates hair growth

keratinocytes.Definition: primary type of cell found in the epidermis

sebum.Definition: gland to lubricate the hair and skin

acupressure.Definition: alternative medicine technique similar to acupuncture

thyroid cartilage.Definition: the thyroid cartilage is the largest of the nine cartilages that make up the laryngeal skeleton, the cartilage structure in and around the trachea that contains the larynx. it does not completely encircle the larynx.

larynx.Definition: kehlkopf, ein organ im nacken von amphibien, reptilien und säugetieren

pathogen.Definition: biological entity that causes disease in its host

benign tumor.Definition: mass of cells which cannot spread throughout the body

epithelium.Definition: tissue lining the surfaces of organs in animals

endocrine gland.Definition: glands of the endocrine system that secrete hormones to blood

allergy.Definition: immune system response to a substance that most people tolerate well

hay fever.Definition: nasal inflammation due to allergens in the air

allergic asthma.Definition: long-term inflammatory disease of the airways of the lungs

sneeze.Definition: semi-autonomous, convulsive expulsion of air from the lungs through the nose and mouth

rhinorrhea.Definition: type of medical symptom where the nasal cavity is filled with fluid mucus

dementia.Definition: long-term brain disorders causing impaired memory, thinking and behavior

short-term memory.Definition: memory used for information that only needs to be stored for a short time

anal canal.Definition: functional segment of the large intestine

large intestine.Definition: last part of the digestive system in vertebrates

ischioanal fossa.Definition: the ischioanal fossa is the fat-filled wedge-shaped space located lateral to the anal canal and inferior to the pelvic diaphragm. it is somewhat prismatic in shape, with its base directed to the surface of the perineum and its apex at the line of meeting of the obturator and anal fasciae.

anatomy.Definition: study of the structure of organisms and their parts

anesthesiology.Definition: medical specialty concerned with anesthesia and perioperative care

medical speciality.Definition: branch of medicine concerning a specific group of diseases or population

perioperative medicine.Definition: perioperative medicine is the medical care of patients from the time of contemplation of surgery through the operative period to full recovery. perioperative care may be provided by an anesthesiologist, intensivist, an internal medicine generalist or hospitalist working with surgical colleagues.

surgery.Definition: medical procedures that involve incisive or invasive instruments into body cavities

angiology.Definition: branch of internal medicine, which deals with vascular disease

circulatory system.Definition: organ system for circulating blood in animals

arteries.Definition: blood vessels that carry blood away from the heart

veins.Definition: blood vessels that carry blood towards the heart

lymphatic vessel.Definition: tubular vessels that are involved in the transport of lymph and lymphocytes

ankle.Definition: region where the foot and the leg meet

human leg.Definition: lower extremity or limb of the human body (foot, lower leg, thigh and hip)

joint.Definition: location at which two or more bones make contact

subtalar joint.Definition:
in human anatomy, the subtalar joint, also known as the
talocalcaneal joint, is a joint of the foot. it occurs at the meeting point of the talus and the calcaneus.

inferior tibiofibular joint.Definition: the inferior tibiofibular joint also known as the distal tibiofibular joint, is formed by the rough, convex surface of the medial side of the distal end of the fibula, and a rough concave surface on the lateral side of the tibia.

plantarflexion.Definition: begriffe, die die bewegung von tieren beschreiben

leg.Definition: weight bearing and locomotive anatomical structure

anterior compartment of the leg.Definition: part of the fascial compartments of leg

dorsum (biology).Definition: standard terms for unambiguous description of relative placement of body parts

popliteal artery.Definition: continuation of the femoral artery that supplies the lower leg

antimicrobial.Definition: drug used to kill microorganisms or stop their growth

medication.Definition: substance used to diagnose, cure, treat, or prevent disease

therapy.Definition: attempted medical remediation of a health problem

antibiotic prophylaxis.Definition: antibiotic prophylaxis refers to, for humans, the prevention of infection complications using antimicrobial therapy. antibiotic prophylaxis in domestic animal feed mixes has been employed in america since at least 1970.

protein.Definition: biomolecule consisting of chains of amino acid residues

plasma cell.Definition: white blood cell that secretes large volumes of antibodies

viral disease.Definition: human, animal or plant disease resulting from a viral infection

artery.Definition: blood vessels that carry blood away from the heart

human body.Definition: entire structure of a human being

aortic bifurcation.Definition: the aortic bifurcation is the point at which the abdominal aorta bifurcates (forks) into the left and right common iliac arteries. the aortic bifurcation is usually seen at the level of l4, just above the junction of the left and right common iliac veins.

systemic circulation.Definition: organ system for circulating blood in animals

prenatal development.Definition: process in which an embryo and later fetus develops during gestation

vermiform.Definition: term meaning shaped like a worm

latin.Definition: indo-european language of the italic branch

human vestigiality.Definition: human traits which lost their original function through evolution

arm.Definition: proximaler teil der freien oberen extremität zwischen schulter und ellenbogen

upper limb.Definition: consists of the arm, forearm, and hand

glenohumeral joint.Definition: synovial ball and socket joint in the shoulder

elbow joint.Definition: joint between the upper and lower parts of the arm

forearm.Definition: region of the upper limb between the elbow and the wrist

hand.Definition: extremität am ende eines arms oder einer vorderextremität

shoulder girdle.Definition: set of bones which connects the arm to the axial skeleton on each side

blood vessel.Definition: tubular structure of the circulatory system which transports blood

microcirculation.Definition: circulation of the blood in the smallest blood vessels

vascular resistance.Definition: force from blood vessels that affects blood flow

blood.Definition: organic fluid which transports nutrients throughout the organism

pulmonary arteries.Definition: artery in pulmonary circulation carrying deoxygenated blood from heart to lungs

umbilical artery.Definition: artery in the abdominal and pelvic regions

effective arterial blood volume.Definition: effective arterial blood volume (eabv) refers to the adequacy of the arterial blood volume to "fill" the capacity of the arterial vasculature. normal eabv exists when the ratio of cardiac output to peripheral resistance maintains venous return and cardiac output at normal levels. eabv can be reduced, therefore, by factors which reduce actual arterial blood volume, increase arterial vascular capacitance or reduce cardiac output. eabv can be reduced in the setting of low, normal, or high actual blood volume. whenever eabv falls, the kidney is triggered to retain sodium and water.

extracellular fluid.Definition: body fluid outside the cells of a multicellular organism

joints.Definition: location at which two or more bones make contact

range of motion.Definition: range of motion is the linear or angular distance that a moving object may normally travel while properly attached to another.

interpersonal relationships.Definition: strong, deep, or close association or acquaintance between two or more people

nonverbal communication.Definition: interpersonal communication through wordless (mostly visual) cues

cognitive development.Definition: field of study in neuroscience and psychology

asthma.Definition: langfristige entzündliche erkrankung der atemwege der lunge

chronic (medicine).Definition: persistent human health condition or disease

bronchospasm.Definition: lower respiratory tract disease that affects the airways leading into the lungs

coughing.Definition: sudden expulsion of air from the lungs as a reflex to clear irritants

muscle tone.Definition: continuous and passive partial contraction of the muscles

atrial fibrillation.Definition: rapid, irregular beating of the atria of the heart

heart arrhythmia.Definition: group of medical conditions characterized by irregular heartbeat

fibrillation.Definition: rapid, irregular contraction of muscle fibers (typically of the heart)

asymptomatic.Definition: patient is a carrier for a disease or infection but experiences no symptoms

neurodevelopmental disorder.Definition: group of disorders that affect the development of the nervous system

attentional shift.Definition: attentional shift occurs when directing attention to a point increases the efficiency of processing of that point and includes inhibition to decrease attentional resources to unwanted or irrelevant inputs. shifting of attention is needed to allocate attentional resources to more efficiently process information from a stimulus. research has shown that when an object or area is attended, processing operates more efficiently. task switching costs occur when performance on a task suffers due to the increased effort added in shifting attention. there are competing theories that attempt to explain why and how attention is shifted as well as how attention is moved through space.

impulsivity.Definition: tendency to act on a whim without considering consequences

age appropriateness.Definition: expected behaviour of a person for their age

auscultation.Definition: listening to the internal sounds of the body, usually using a stethoscope

respiratory system.Definition: biological system in animals and plants for gas exchange

heart sounds.Definition: noise generated by the beating heart

gastrointestinal system.Definition: organ system within humans and other animals

social interaction.Definition: any interpersonal relationship between two or more individuals within and/or between groups

behavior.Definition: actions by entities within a system

axilla.Definition: area of the human body beneath the joint between arm and torso

axillary artery.Definition: large blood vessel bringing oxygenated blood to the thorax

rib.Definition: long bone in vertebrates that protects vital respiratory and cardiovascular organs

subclavian artery.Definition: major arteries of the upper thorax, below the clavicle

posterior (anatomy).Definition: standard terms for unambiguous description of relative placement of body parts

buttock.Definition: anatomical feature on the posterior of some primates

neck.Definition: part of the body on many vertebrates that connects the head with the torso

surface anatomy.Definition: study of the external features of the body of an animal

chest.Definition: frontal part of an animal's body, between its head and abdomen

acute (medicine).Definition: disease with a rapid onset and/or a short course

chronic condition.Definition: persistent human health condition or disease

physiology.Definition: science regarding function of organisms or living systems

basal metabolic rate.Definition: rate of energy expenditure by an endotherm at rest

beta cell.Definition: type of cell found in pancreatic islets

cell (biology).Definition: basic unit of many life forms

diabetes mellitus type 2.Definition: type of diabetes mellitus with high blood sugar and insulin resistance

biceps.Definition: muscle on the front of the upper arm

scapula.Definition: bone that connects the humerus (upper arm bone) with the clavicle (collar bone)

supination.Definition: begriffe, die die bewegung von tieren beschreiben

bile.Definition: dark greenish-brown fluid aiding in the digestion of fats

digestion.Definition: biological process of breaking down food

gallbladder.Definition: organ in humans and other vertebrates

intestine.Definition: organ system within humans and other animals

gall bladder.Definition: organ in humans and other vertebrates

electrolyte.Definition: ionic solids whose dissociation in water free up ions carrying the electrical current in solution

bile acid.Definition: steroid acid found predominantly in the bile of mammals and other vertebrates

eating disorder.Definition: mental illness characterized by abnormal eating habits that negatively affect health

binge eating.Definition: muster, das durch ungeordnetes essen in allen lebensaktivitäten gekennzeichnet ist

food addiction.Definition: behavioral addiction characterized by compulsory indulgence over foods

biological engineering.Definition: application of biology and engineering to create useful products

bioinformatics.Definition: computational analysis of large, complex sets of biological data

thermodynamics.Definition: physics of heat, work, and temperature

natural science.Definition: branch of science about the natural world

organism.Definition: any individual living being or physical living system

biochemistry.Definition: study of chemical processes in living organisms

molecular biology.Definition: branch of biology which studies biological activities at molecular level

developmental biology.Definition: study of how organisms develop and grow

evolution.Definition: veränderung der vererbbaren merkmale biologischer populationen

chemical process.Definition: change in matter of constant composition, usually involving other such matters

interdisciplinary.Definition: combination of two or more academic disciplines into one activity

software tool.Definition: computer program that software developers use to support other programs and applications

statistics.Definition: study of the collection, analysis, interpretation, and presentation of data

interventional cardiology.Definition: interventional cardiology is a branch of cardiology that deals specifically with the catheter based treatment of structural heart diseases. andreas gruentzig is considered the father of interventional cardiology after the development of angioplasty by interventional radiologist charles dotter.

sampling (medicine).Definition: collection of bodily substances for medical assessment

biological tissue.Definition: group of cells having similar appearance and performing the same function

biostatistics.Definition: application of statistical techniques to biological systems

experiment.Definition: wissenschaftliches verfahren zur validierung einer hypothese

medicine.Definition: diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of illness

agriculture.Definition: cultivation of plants and animals to provide useful products

bipolar disorder.Definition: mental disorder that causes periods of depression and abnormally elevated mood

depression (mood).Definition: state of low mood and aversion to activity

pregnancy.Definition: time of offspring development in mother's body

bladder cancer.Definition: urinary system cancer that begins in the urinary bladder

tissue (biology).Definition: group of cells having similar appearance and performing the same function

urinary bladder.Definition: organ in humans and vertebrates that collects and stores urine from the kidneys before disposal

metastasize.Definition: spread of a disease inside a body

blood pressure.Definition: pressure exerted by circulating blood upon the walls of arteries

systole.Definition: teil des herzzyklus, wenn sich eine herzkammer zusammenzieht

mercury (element).Definition: chemical element, symbol hg and atomic number 80

atmospheric pressure.Definition: static pressure exerted by the weight of the atmosphere

bone.Definition: rigid organs that constitute part of the endoskeleton of vertebrates

stiffness.Definition: resistance to deformation in response to force

organ (anatomy).Definition: collection of tissues with similar functions

skeleton.Definition: part of the body that forms the supporting structure

red blood cell.Definition: oxygen-delivering blood cell and the most common type of blood cell

white blood cell.Definition: type of cells of the immunological system

mineral.Definition: kristallines chemisches element oder eine durch geologische prozesse gebildete verbindung

function (biology).Definition: reason for a change under natural selection; in physiology, what a system does

bone marrow.Definition: semi-solid tissue in the spongy portions of bones

marrow adipose tissue.Definition: bone marrow adipose tissue (bmat), sometimes referred to as marrow adipose tissue (mat), is a type of fat deposit in bone marrow. it increases in states of low bone density -osteoporosis, anorexia nervosa/ caloric restriction, skeletal unweighting such as that which occurs in space travel, and anti-diabetes therapies. bmat decreases in anaemia, leukaemia, and hypertensive heart failure; in response to hormones such as oestrogen, leptin, and growth hormone; with exercise-induced weight loss or bariatric surgery; in response to chronic cold exposure; and in response to pharmacological agents such as bisphosphonates, teriparatide, and metformin.

ventral.Definition: standardbegriffe zur eindeutigen beschreibung der relativen anordnung von körperteilen

elbow-joint.Definition: joint between the upper and lower parts of the arm

pulse.Definition: tactile arterial palpation of the heartbeat by trained fingertips

palpation.Definition: vorgang, bei dem man den körper mit den händen überprüft

tendon.Definition: type of tissue that connects muscle to bone

biceps brachii muscle.Definition: muscle on the front of the upper arm

plexus.Definition: wo sich wurzel- und astnerven treffen

ventral ramus of spinal nerve.Definition: the ventral ramus is the anterior division of a spinal nerve. the ventral rami supply the antero-lateral parts of the trunk and the limbs. they are mainly larger than the dorsal rami.

spinal nerve.Definition: nerve that carries signals between the spinal cord and the body

cervical spinal nerve 5.Definition: the cervical spinal nerve 5 (c5) is a spinal nerve of the cervical segment.

cervical spinal nerve 6.Definition: the cervical spinal nerve 6 (c6) is a spinal nerve of the cervical segment.

cervical spinal nerve 7.Definition: the cervical spinal nerve 7 (c7) is a spinal nerve of the cervical segment.

cervical spinal nerve 8.Definition: the cervical spinal nerve 8 (c8) is a spinal nerve of the cervical segment.

thoracic spinal nerve 1.Definition: the thoracic spinal nerve 1 (t1) is a spinal nerve of the thoracic segment.

spinal cord.Definition: long, tubular central nervous system structure in the vertebral column

2013–2014 zika virus outbreaks in oceani.Definition: in october 2013, there was an outbreak of zika fever in french polynesia, the first outbreak of several zika outbreaks across oceania. with 8,723 cases reported, it was the largest outbreak of zika fever before the outbreak in the americas that began in april 2015. an earlier outbreak occurred on yap island in the federated states of micronesia in 2007, but it is thought that the 2013–2014 outbreak involved an independent introduction of the zika virus from southeast asia. investigators suggested that the outbreaks of mosquito-borne diseases in the pacific from 2012 to 2014 were "the early stages of a wave that will continue for several years", particularly because of their vulnerability to infectious diseases stemming from isolation and immunologically naive populations.

list of medical roots, suffixes and pref.Definition: this is a list of roots, suffixes, and prefixes used in medical terminology, their meanings, and their etymologies. most of them are combining forms in neo-latin and hence international scientific vocabulary. there are a few general rules about how they combine. first, prefixes and suffixes, most of which are derived from ancient greek or classical latin, have a droppable -o-. as a general rule, this -o- almost always acts as a joint-stem to connect two consonantal roots, but generally, the -o- is dropped when connecting to a vowel-stem. second, medical roots generally go together according to language, i.e., greek prefixes occur with greek suffixes and latin prefixes with latin suffixes. although international scientific vocabulary is not stringent about segregating combining forms of different languages, it is advisable when coining new words not to mix different lingual roots.
